alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 10:26PM EDT until June 26 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Morris County in northern New Jersey... * Until 1100 PM EDT. * At 1026 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Morris Plains, or near Morristown, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Victory Gardens, Parsippany, Pequannock Township, Lake Telemark, Succasunna-Kenvil, White Meadow Lake and Hanover Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 31 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 33 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
